alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clay; Oktibbeha; Webster (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 30 at 5:20PM CDT until March 30 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northeastern Choctaw County in central Mississippi... Northwestern Oktibbeha County in northeastern Mississippi... Webster County in north central Mississippi... Southwestern Clay County in northeastern Mississippi... * Until 615 PM CDT. * At 520 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms capable of producing a tornado were located along a line extending from near Sabougla to near Embry to near Poplar Creek, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * These dangerous storms will be near... Embry around 525 PM CDT. Bellefontaine around 530 PM CDT. Chester around 535 PM CDT. Eupora around 540 PM CDT. Sherwood and Reform around 545 PM CDT. Mathiston around 550 PM CDT. Maben, Cumberland and Clarkson around 555 PM CDT. Pheba around 605 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these tornadic storms include Mantee and Walthall. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
